name: pathway
content:

a track that a person can walk along: New pedestrian pathways are being built alongside the road.
a series of actions that can be taken in order to achieve something: Working your way up through a company is a difficult pathway. He has supported legislation that would grant most illegal immigrants a pathway to citizenship. Ms. Smith, the foundation's president, hopes it can help open new pathways for young black men.
medical
  specialized a series of actions that is taken in a particular situation, especially as part of medical treatment: The patient should be given a full explanation of the treatment pathway and this may include information sheets about their medication. What proportion of Alzheimer's sufferers follow this pathway?
medical, biology
  specialized a way for something to spread within the body or between bodies: The mind creates its own neural pathways. Lesions caused by syphilis can provide a pathway for HIV infection.
biology
  specialized a set of connected chemical reactions in biology: The fish can derive energy from sugars via a biochemical pathway that doesn't require oxygen but is far less efficient than the oxygen route.
More examplesFewer examplesMost of the zoo's main attractions are arrayed along the central pathway.Please stick to the pathway and do not walk on the grass verges.A diplomatic effort might help open a pathway to stability and security in the region.This relativistic culture portrays all faiths as essentially equal and viable pathways to the same God.Our role is to ensure that the patients follow the relevant clinical pathway in as smooth and pleasant a way as possible.The drug affects the pathways that allow cells to communicate with one another in certain regions of the brain.Some cancer cells have learned how to hijack the body's inflammatory pathways.
